pr_title: Support regex to include or exclude the names in alarm module

timeline.message: Support regex to include or exclude the names

timeline.author: kezhenxu94
kezhenxu94

timeline.bodyText: This default value may break existed versions, right?
timeline.author: kezhenxu94
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -50,6 +50,7 @@ rules:
     metrics-name: service_instance_resp_time
     op: ">"
     threshold: 1000
+    include-names-regex: instance\_\d+

replies.bodyText: I write on the wrong file, I will change it into the demo file tomorrow.
replies.author: mrproliu

replies.bodyText: Change it into the alarm-settings-sample.yml file.
replies.author: mrproliu

timeline.bodyText: What happens if include names and include names regex exist both? I think we should indicate in the document.
timeline.author: wu-sheng
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -22,6 +22,8 @@ Alarm rule is constituted by following keys
 [List of all potential metrics name](#list-of-all-potential-metrics-name).
 - **Include names**. The following entity names are included in this rule. Please follow [Entity name define](#entity-name).
 - **Exclude names**. The following entity names are excluded in this rule. Please follow [Entity name define](#entity-name).
+- **Include names regex**. Provide a regex to include the entity names.
+- **Exclude names regex**. Provide a regex to exclude the exclude names.

replies.bodyText: I think both will take effect.
replies.author: mrproliu

timeline.bodyText:
This string#matches includes Pattern p = Pattern.compile(regex), due to we have the regex expression before all checked, I think we should compile them first when loading the config or config changed.
Could you run a benchmark to show the performance difference between this and the pre-compiled match?
timeline.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText:
I do a little benchmark, using regex Service\_\d+ to match Service_1, make a loop with 10 million times.
String#matches: 7198 millisecond
Pattern#matcher()#matches(): 977 millisecond
I will change to using the pre-build mode, thanks.
replies.author: mrproliu

timeline.message: using pre-build mode with regex patten

timeline.bodyText: Just a reminder, as we are using JDK8+, Optional could replace all these !=null. But both of these styles exist today. So, don't require change, anyway.
timeline.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText: Thanks, I will change to this way since next PR.
replies.author: mrproliu
